title: TRACK-1A: Proto-First API (Connect + MCP)
description: HTTP API wrapper for existing kinen-go service. Thin layer ~300-500 lines. See artifacts/handover-track-1a.md
design: One proto → HTTP + gRPC + MCP. Use Connect RPC + protoc-gen-go-mcp. Deletes hand-written cmd/kinen/mcp/ (~300 lines). Schema IS the API contract.
acceptance_criteria: HTTP works; gRPC works; MCP works (generated); Old MCP code deleted; All from same proto
notes:
⚠️ BLOCKING BUG: kinen-5kc

Build fails! MCP wiring is broken. Fix the bug before closing this epic.

Run: `bd show kinen-5kc` for details.

Summary:
1. Wrong function: use `RegisterKinenServiceHandler` not `ForwardToKinenServiceHandler`
2. Wrong method: use `server.ServeStdio(mcpServer)` not `mcpServer.ServeStdio()`
3. Need adapter: KinenServer uses Connect-style, MCP needs gRPC-style interface

Fix, then verify: `go build ./cmd/kinen/mcp/...`

title: BUG [1A]: MCP wiring broken - wrong function names
description:
Build fails due to incorrect MCP server wiring in cmd/kinen/mcp/main.go

ERRORS:
```
cmd/kinen/mcp/main.go:46:11: undefined: kinenmcp.ForwardToKinenServiceHandler
cmd/kinen/mcp/main.go:49:22: mcpServer.ServeStdio undefined
```

FIXES NEEDED:

1. Line 46 - Wrong function name:
   - Current: `kinenmcp.ForwardToKinenServiceHandler(mcpServer, kinenServer)`
   - Should be: `kinenmcp.RegisterKinenServiceHandler(mcpServer, kinenServer)`

2. Line 49 - Method doesn't exist on MCPServer:
   - Current: `mcpServer.ServeStdio()`
   - Should be: `server.ServeStdio(mcpServer)` (standalone function)

3. INTERFACE MISMATCH - Our KinenServer uses Connect-style:
   ```go
   func (s *KinenServer) Search(ctx, *connect.Request[SearchRequest]) (*connect.Response[SearchResponse], error)
   ```
   But KinenServiceServer expects gRPC-style:
   ```go
   Search(ctx, *SearchRequest) (*SearchResponse, error)
   ```

   SOLUTION: Create an adapter in internal/server/ that wraps KinenServer and satisfies KinenServiceServer interface. Each method unwraps the request and wraps the response.

After fix, verify with: `go build ./cmd/kinen/mcp/...`

title: BLOCKED [1F]: pdfcpu API doesn't match documentation
description:
Issue: pdfcpu v0.11.1 doesn't have ExtractTextFile or NewDefaultConfiguration functions as documented in web examples.

What I tried:
- Checked go doc for ExtractTextFile - doesn't exist
- Checked for ExtractPageText - doesn't exist  
- Checked source code - no text extraction functions found in api package
- Tried various import paths (pdfcpu/pkg/model, pdfcpu/pkg/pdfcpu)

Options:
A) Use pdfcpu CLI via exec.Command (works but less clean)
B) Switch to different PDF library (rsc.io/pdf, unidoc/unipdf)
C) Find correct pdfcpu API/method for text extraction

Recommendation: B - switch to rsc.io/pdf or unidoc/unipdf which have clearer text extraction APIs.

Files: internal/resources/pdf.go (blocked on API)
notes:
COORDINATOR DECISION: Accept Option A - Use pdfcpu CLI via exec.Command.

Rationale:
- It already works
- pdfcpu CLI is mature and well-tested
- Switching libraries now adds risk and delay
- Can revisit if performance becomes an issue

Continue with 1F.2 (Resource scanner).

title: REFACTOR [1B]: Move ALL domain types to proto (proto-first)
description:
ARCHITECTURAL DECISION: All domain types must be defined in proto first.

Currently internal/kinen/types.go defines domain types separately. These need to cross the wire to VSCode extension, so they MUST be in the proto.

REFACTOR STEPS:

1. ADD to api/kinen/kinen.proto - Session/Round types:
   - ParsedRound, RoundFrontmatter
   - Question, Option
   - WikiLink
   - ParsedArtifact, ArtifactFrontmatter, Section
   - ParsedSession (if needed)

2. ADD service methods for sessions/rounds:
   - GetRound, ListRounds
   - GetSession, ListSessions
   - GetArtifact

3. Run: buf generate api/kinen/kinen.proto

4. DELETE internal/kinen/types.go (replaced by generated)

5. UPDATE parsers to return proto types:
   - frontmatter.go
   - wikilinks.go
   - round.go

6. UPDATE kinen_server.go with new RPC implementations

7. ADD TEST FIXTURES:
   - Create testdata/kinen/ directory
   - Add real kinen session/round fixtures:
     - testdata/kinen/sessions/example-session/init.md
     - testdata/kinen/sessions/example-session/rounds/01-foundation.md
     - testdata/kinen/sessions/example-session/artifacts/spec.md
   - Use fixtures in parser tests
   - Tests should parse real kinen files, not just inline strings

PRINCIPLE: Proto is single source of truth for ALL types that cross any boundary (API, extension, CLI).

ACCEPTANCE:
- internal/kinen/types.go DELETED
- All types defined in kinen.proto
- Parsers use generated proto types
- testdata/kinen/ has real fixtures
- Tests use fixtures from testdata/
- go build ./... passes
- go test ./... passes
notes:
✅ UNBLOCKED by coordinator!

Fixed:
- buf.gen.yaml was applying mlservice package to ALL protos (removed managed override)
- Regenerated protos - now have correct 'kinen' package
- Fixed all import references in validation.go, validation_test.go
- Added stub implementations for GetRound/ListRounds/GetSession/ListSessions/GetArtifact
- Build passes: go build ./cmd/... ./internal/... ./pkg/...

Remaining for 1B:
- TestParseRound_Basic failing - round parser not extracting questions (0 instead of 2)
- Debug ParseRound() logic - question regex or parsing not working
- Run: go test ./internal/kinen/... -v

title: 1B.2: Wiki-link extractor
description: Extract [[wiki-links]] with display text, line numbers, context
design: Regex: \[\[([^\]|]+)(\|[^\]]+)?\]\]. Return target, display text, line number, surrounding context.
acceptance_criteria: Extracts [[link]], [[link|display]], [[folder/link]]; Provides line numbers; Works with 100+ links per file
notes:
COORDINATOR: Good progress on frontmatter! Continue with wiki-links.

CURRENT TASK: Wiki-link extractor (kinen-fnu)

Requirements:
1. Extract `[[link]]`, `[[link|display]]`, `[[folder/link]]`, `[[link#heading]]`
2. Return: target, display text (if any), line number
3. Skip matches inside code blocks (``` or `)
4. Handle 100+ links per file efficiently

Implementation approach:
```go
// internal/kinen/wikilinks.go
type WikiLink struct {
    Target      string  // The link target (e.g., "some-file")
    Display     string  // Optional display text after |
    Heading     string  // Optional #heading anchor
    LineNumber  int     // 1-based line number
}

func ExtractWikiLinks(content string) []WikiLink {
    // Regex: \[\[([^\]|#]+)(#[^\]|]+)?(\|[^\]]+)?\]\]
    // Skip code blocks first, then extract
}
```

WHEN DONE:
```bash
bd close kinen-fnu --reason "Wiki-link extractor implemented with tests"
bd update kinen-0hj --status in_progress  # 1B.3: Round parser
```

Next task (1B.3 Round parser) will build on your frontmatter + wiki-link work!

title: QUESTION [1F]: Integration approach for PDF + Resources parser
description:
Context: Starting Track 1F implementation. Need clarification on integration approach.

Questions:

1. HTTP API endpoint: The handover mentions '/api/v1/index/build' endpoint. Should I:
   A) Implement this new endpoint (requires HTTP server setup)
   B) Integrate via existing LoadData path (simpler, reuses existing infrastructure)
   
   Recommendation: B - reuse existing LoadData infrastructure unless HTTP API is required.

2. PDF library: Handover specifies pdfcpu. Should I:
   A) Use pdfcpu as specified (github.com/pdfcpu/pdfcpu)
   B) Consider alternatives (e.g., rsc.io/pdf for simpler text extraction)
   
   Recommendation: A - follow handover spec unless there are known issues.

3. Integration point: How should resources integrate with indexing?
   A) Extend DataLoader interface to support 'resource' format
   B) Create separate ResourceLoader that converts to document format
   C) Direct integration into index builder (bypasses LoadData)
   
   Recommendation: B - keeps separation of concerns, resources convert to document format.

4. Missing tasks: Handover mentions 1F.3 (Web clip parser) and 1F.4 (Index builder hook) but these aren't in beads. Should I:
   A) Create these tasks now
   B) Wait for clarification
   
   Recommendation: A - create tasks to track all work.

Files involved:
- handover-track-1f.md (lines 115-123)
- cmd/kinen/internal/service/loader.go (existing DataLoader interface)
- internal/resources/ (new package to create)
notes:
COORDINATOR RESPONSE:

All your recommendations are correct! Proceed with:

1. **HTTP API**: B ✅ - Reuse existing LoadData infrastructure. Track 1A will provide the HTTP API later.

2. **PDF library**: A ✅ - Use pdfcpu as specified.

3. **Integration point**: B ✅ - Create separate ResourceLoader that converts to document format. Good separation of concerns.

4. **Missing tasks**: A ✅ - Yes, create tasks 1F.3 and 1F.4 now:
   ```bash
   bd create "1F.3: Web clip parser" -t task -p 2 --parent kinen-5iv
   bd create "1F.4: Index builder hook" -t task -p 2 --parent kinen-5iv
   ```

**Summary**: Your analysis is solid. Follow your recommendations. Create the internal/resources/ package and start with PDF extraction (1F.1).

Good judgment showing initiative by asking before diving in!

title: BUG [1F]: PDF parser uses wrong pdfcpu API
description:
Build fails due to incorrect pdfcpu API usage in internal/resources/pdf.go

ERRORS:
```
internal/resources/pdf.go:32:17: undefined: pdfcpu.NewDefaultConfiguration
internal/resources/pdf.go:33:12: undefined: api.ExtractTextFile
internal/resources/pdf.go:84:17: undefined: pdfcpu.NewDefaultConfiguration
internal/resources/pdf.go:85:12: undefined: api.ExtractTextFile
```

INVESTIGATION NEEDED:
1. Check pdfcpu API documentation: https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/pdfcpu/pdfcpu
2. Find correct functions for:
   - Creating configuration
   - Extracting text from PDF files

LIKELY FIX:
The API may have changed or be different than expected. Check:
- `pdfcpu.LoadConfiguration()`
- `api.ExtractContentFile()` or similar

After fix, verify with: `go build ./internal/resources/...`
Then run tests: `go test ./internal/resources/...`
